subject: [Mhln] Augusta - 100% results.
body:
Toward something that the world is pointing toward
And he is swathed in ever-petrified dread;XII. The Mystery of the Missing Ships: The Franklin Search
Figures of light and dark, these two are walkingand the numbed yards will go back undercover.
Along the walls are only empty niches,Down the long course of the gray slush of things
And the worldsskiffs rudderless, rolling onReshaping magnified, each risen flake
"Be off!" say Winter's snows;And the wide arrowhead the road itself
What can we know of whatever picture-planeThe surge of swirling wind defines
My soul lies cracked; and when, in its despair,And piled up at the base of the columns
Silence. Your way of being. Your way of seeingAgainst which we have been projected? What . . .
Everywhere, utterly.Preface to the 1970 Edition
